instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boardview problem
threads.message: Hi everyone, I think I have the boardview for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, and am currently working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A.  The area around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> (where I think my problem may be) looks vastly different.  Does anyone have the boardview for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A?
